raw_text:
Buffy creator joins Wonder Woman
 
 The creator of Buffy the Vampire Slayer is to take on a new female superhero after signing up to write and direct the Wonder Woman movie.
 
 Joss Whedon described the DC Comics character as "the most iconic female heroine of our time". "In a way, no one has met her yet," he said. "What I love most about icons is finding out what's behind them, exploring the price of their power." Linda Carter played the character in the 1970s TV series. The character of Wonder Woman, famed for her red and gold costume, was born on Paradise Island, and was blessed with the powers of strength and flight. The film is being produced by Joel Silver, producer of the Matrix trilogy.
 
 "There's no one better than Joss to adapt the legendary Wonder Woman comic book character created in the 1940s into a dynamic feature film for 21st Century audiences," said Silver. "Wonder Woman was the first great female superhero to emerge from comic books and later inspire millions of fans in her television incarnation... but this groundbreaking heroine has yet to be reinvented for the feature film arena." Whedon created the character of Buffy in the screenplay for the 1992 film. He distanced himself from the movie because of the direction it eventually took, and the film bombed. But he did not give up on the Slayer and went on to write and executive produce seven seasons of the cult TV series. He also produced the spin-off Angel series. He is currently directing the film Serenity, based on his short-lived sci-fi series Firefly.
llama3.2:1b: Buffy creator Joss Whedon joins Wonder Woman project. Whedon will write and direct the movie after signing up to adapt the character into a feature film for 21st century audiences. He believes he is the right person to bring the iconic heroine to life. The film, produced by Joel Silver, aims to reinvent the character.
llama3.2:3b: Joss Whedon has signed to write and direct a Wonder Woman movie for DC Comics, describing her as "the most iconic female heroine of our time". The film is being produced by Joel Silver and will be a dynamic feature film for 21st-century audiences.
gemma2:2b: Joss Whedon will write and direct a Wonder Woman movie. He has described the character as iconic and believes there is much to explore about her power and background. Joel Silver, producer of The Matrix trilogy, produced the film and praised Whedon's adaptation skills, noting that this will be Wonder Woman’s first major feature film incarnation.  Whedon created Buffy the Vampire Slayer and also wrote for its spin-off series Angel, as well as directing Serenity, a sci-fi film based on his show Firefly.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The creator of Buffy the Vampire Slayer has been promoted by Joel Silver to take over Wonder Woman in a major film production. Joss Whedon described how Wonder Woman was a "most iconic female hero" and that finding out what's behind her power is important. Silver is producing a new DC movie about a modern superhero with a 21st century audience, inspired by the original character. Whedon created the comic book character in the script of the 1990s film before he left, but he did not give up on the role and has directed a spin-off series. The upcoming Wonder Woman film is based on his short-lived sci-fi series Firefly.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Joss Whedon, creator of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, has signed on to write and direct the Wonder Woman movie, focusing on creating a new interpretation for the iconic DC Comics character known as "the most iconic female heroine of our time."
qwen2.5:3b: The creator of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Joss Whedon, has signed up for a new project to write and direct the Wonder Woman movie. Described as the "most iconic female heroine," Wonder Woman hails from Paradise Island with powers of strength and flight. Produced by Joel Silver, who is also behind the Matrix trilogy, this film marks an opportunity for Whedon to adapt the legendary character for 21st Century audiences. A departure from his previous work on Buffy, Whedon brings extensive experience in superhero narratives, having previously created Buffy, produced Angel, and directed Serenity.
opencoder:1.5b: "Buffy creator joins Wonder Woman" is a description of a character in a fictional movie. The character Buffy the Vampire Slayer was created by Joss Whedon for a 1992 feature film. "Wonder Woman" is said to have been one of the first great female superheroes to emerge from comic books and later inspired millions of fans in her television incarnation, but this groundbreaking heroine has yet to be reinvented for the feature film arena.

First, the creator of Buffy is taking over a new role as someone new, probably in writing and directing the next movie for Wonder Woman. They called her Joss Whendon or something like that? Wait, actually, I think he's named Joss When on TV but now creating a movie under a different name.

The text mentions Joss When describing DC comics as the most iconic female heroine. He says no one has met her yet and talks about exploring their power. That's a good summary of that part.

Linda Carter was in the old TV series, playing Wonder Woman with her red and gold costume. She's born on Paradise Island and has strength and flight powers. The film is produced by Joel Silver, who makes the Matrix movies. Joss Whendon says Silver should take him forward into a feature film based on that comic.

Whendon mentioned the 1940s character was legendary but not yet reinvented for big audiences, like in TV. He didn't give up and did his own spin-off series called Angel. Then he's now directing a new film called Serenity based on another short sci-fi series called Firefly by Whendon as well.

Joss Whendon is taking over the role of creating and directing the next Wonder Woman movie, likely replacing Linda Carter. He describes DC's Wonder Woman as an iconic female heroine whose power hasn't been reinvented yet, exploring their potential through his own spin-off series Angel.
tinyllama:1.1b: Warner Bros. Has announced that Josw Whedon will write and direct Wonder Woman for the big screen. The DC Comics character has long been an iconic female heroine who has captivated audiences with her strength and flight, and the studio has a long history of adapting characters into films. Silver, producer of the Matrix triology, is excited to bring this legendary figure to life, and says that Whedon's talent in creating Buffy, one of the most iconic comic book characters ever created, makes him the perfect choice for the project. As a fan of the character's comic book incarnation, Whedon has been eager to adapt her into the film arena since his days as the writer and executive producer of the cult TV series, Buffy the Vampire Slayer. In his directorial debut, he has already created two successful short-lived sci-fi series, Firefly, based on the character's universe in the same vein as the comic book.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Joss Whedon, who created both Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Firefly, has been tapped to adapt Wonder Woman into a feature film for DC Comics, following the success of Christopher Nolan's The Dark Knight Trilogy and Marvel's Captain America: The Winter Soldier. Whedon has long been intrigued by the iconic character and hopes to bring her to life in a powerful, contemporary way that showcases the incredible power she wields. His association with both Buffy and Firefly also gives him a unique perspective on this powerful heroine, which he will bring to the screen. Whedon is also excited about the potential for Wonder Woman to inspire fans of all genders, races, and backgrounds. The movie is being produced by Joel Silver, who has a successful track record in adapting comic book characters to the big screen. Silver's recent successes include adapting the Matrix trilogy and producing the television series based on DC Comics' iconic characters. Whedon's involvement in this project highlights his strong support for bringing Wonder Woman to life in a dynamic and exciting way, while also showcasing his own unique creative vision for the film.
